thread.title: Arsenal news: Alexis Sanchez stats show they can't afford to lose him | Metro News
thread.title_full: Arsenal news: Alexis Sanchez stats show they can't afford to lose him | Metro News

author: Mark Brus For Metro.Co.Uk
title: Arsenal news: Alexis Sanchez stats show they can't afford to lose him | Metro News
text:
Mark Brus for Metro.co.uk Thursday 16 Feb 2017 5:54 pm Alexis Sanchez has been in superb form this season (Picture: Getty) 
Arsenal may have had a dire evening against Bayern Munich last night, but Alexis Sanchez scored his 20th goal of the season to highlight his importance to the club. Paul Pogba shows brotherly love after Florentin is forced off injured 
The Chile international is being strongly linked with a move away from the Emirates Stadium as he continues to stall on signing a new contract, which is set to expire at the end of next season. 
Arsenal signed Sanchez from Barcelona in 2014, and since then he has been one of the Gunners’ most important players, though he’s arguably stepped up a level this term. Sanchez’s Arsenal future is up in the air at the moment (Picture: Getty) 
With a superb record of 20 goals and 13 assists in 2016/17 so far, Sanchez has been involved in an incredible 33 goals in just 31 appearances in all competitions. Sanchez 2016/17 stats 20 goals 13 assists 
The 28-year-old has been linked with big clubs like Paris Saint-Germain, Juventus and Real Madrid, and clearly has the ability to play for an elite European side after his remarkable impact on this struggling side. 
Sanchez scored from a rebound after missing a penalty against Bayern, but could do little more to prevent a crushing 5-1 defeat at the Allianz Arena that surely leaves Arsenal with no chance of making it through to the quarter-finals.
